thread.title: Nasa to study the solar system and develop methods for manned missions to celestial bodies
thread.title_full: Nasa to study the solar system and develop methods for manned missions to celestial bodies

author: IANS
title: Nasa to study the solar system and develop methods for manned missions to celestial bodies
text:
Nasa has added four new teams to study the Moon, near-Earth asteroids and other components of the solar system. According to a report in Engadget on Sunday, the first group from the University of Colorado will study on robotics, cosmology, astrophysics and heliophysics to advance manned space exploration. While the second group has been assigned on a project called “Toolbox for Research and Exploration”, responsible for developing tools and methods for the manned exploration of celestial bodies.
“The third group from Georgia Institute of Technology will explore how radiation affects human-made composite materials. They’ll also look into how real-time detectors can help minimise astronauts’ exposure to harmful radiation,” the report added. The fourth group, called Exploration Science Pathfinder Research for Enhancing Solar System Observations or ESPRESSO will assist Nasa in understanding the events that are hazardous for robotic and human explorers in space.
With the better knowledge of hazardous events in space, disasters can be predicted and managed. “Nasa will set aside $3 to $5 million of its budget per year to fund the teams’ research for the next five years,” the report noted.
 
The post Nasa to study the solar system and develop methods for manned missions to celestial bodies appeared first on Tech2 .
